document.masterDocTitle: Validity of Epigonus megalops (Perciformes: Epigonidae), Redescription of E. atherinoides, and First Record of E. draco from the Central South Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Validity of Epigonus megalops (Perciformes: Epigonidae), Redescription of E. atherinoides, and First Record of E. draco from the Central South Pacific

bibRefCitation.author: Okamoto, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Okamoto, M. 2015. Epigonus draco, a new species of deepwater cardinalfish (Perciformes: Epigonidae) from the western Pacific. Species Diversity 20: 121 - 127.

subSubSection.paragraph: [English name: Dragon Deepwater Cardinalfish] ( Figs 3 , 6 ; Tables 1–2 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epigonus draco Okamoto, 2015: 121
, fig.
1 [original description, type locality: Solomon Islands ( 07°43′34″S , 158°29′24″E ; 08°41′16″S , 157°41′27″E ), western South Pacific ]
.

Epigonus ctenolepis
(not of Mochizuki and Shirakihara, 1983 ):
Iwamoto and McCosker 2014: 291
, fig. 122 (between Luzon and Mindoro, Philippines ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. 2 specimens , 87.1–104.7 mm SL.
Society Islands :
MNHN 2014-0217 , 104.7 mm SL, 16°41′11″S , 151°25′30″W , Raiatea island ,
638–700 m depth
,
16 October 2009
; MNHN 2014-0871 , 87.1 mm SL, 16°46′31″S , 151°22′41″W , Raiatea island ,
573–611 m depth
,
18 October 2009
.

Other material examined .
6 specimens 88.8–160.1mm SL.
Solomon Islands :
MNHN 2006-0589 , holotype , 127.4 mm SL, 07°43′34″S , 158°29′24″E ,
391–623 m depth
,
25 October 2004
; MNHN 2006-0684 , paratype , 88.8 mm SL, same data as holotype; MNHN 2006-0063 , 2 paratypes , 110.0–145.0mm SL, 08°41′16″S , 157°41′27″E ,
786 m depth
,
5 November 2004
.
Philippines :
CAS 235796 , paratype , 160.1 mm SL, 13°36′7″N , 120°23′2″E , between Luzon and Mindoro ,
541–636 m depth
,
1 June 2011
.
Vanuatu :
MNHN 2012-0836 , paratype , 128.1 mm SL, 15°41′31″S , 167°01′19″E , west of Malo Island ,
481 m depth
,
17 September 2006
.

Diagnosis. A species of
Epigonus
with the following combination of characters: dorsal-fin rays VII-I, 10; pectoral-fin rays 19–20; total gill rakers 22–23; pyloric caeca 7–10; pored lateral-line scales 47–49+3–4; scales below lateral line 9; vertebrae 10 + 15; opercular spine present; maxillary mustache-like processes absent; ribs absent on last abdominal vertebra; uppermost margin of pectoral-fin base lower than horizontal line through center of eye; proximal radial of first anal-fin pterygiophore slender; and mouth cavity black.

Distribution ( Fig. 3 ). Known from the Philippines , Solomon Islands , Vanuatu ( Okamoto 2015 ), and Society Islands (present study), at depths of
391– 786 m
.

Remarks.
Epigonus draco
was originally described on the basis of six specimens collected from the Philippines , Solomon Islands , and Vanuatu in the western Pacific ( Okamoto 2015 ). The present specimens represent the first record of this species from the Society Islands ( Fig. 6 ). These distributional records are located between 15°N and 20°S at depths greater than 390 m ; this species is distributed on continental slopes in the western and central tropical Pacific ( Fig. 3 ).

Epigonus draco
,
E. atherinoides
, and
E. megalops
belong to the
E. constanciae
group because of having a pungent opercular spine; they are all distributed in the Western Pacific ( Mochizuki and Shirakihara 1983 ; Okamoto 2015 ; present study, Fig. 3 ). All three species are similar in having a small number of gill rakers ( Table 2 ) and lacking ribs on the last abdominal vertebra, but
E. draco
differs in having the uppermost margin of the pectoral-fin base lower than a horizontal line through the center of the eye ( vs. subequal to the center of the eye, Fig. 5A ) and lacking a pair of maxillary mustache-like processes ( vs. blunt maxillary mustache-like processes present, Fig. 2 ).

The present specimens match the morphological description given by Okamoto (2015) , and their meristic and morphometric features are similar to those of the type specimens ( Table 1 ). The counts of pyloric caeca are slightly different (9–10 herein vs. 7–9 in the type series), but well within the typical range of meristic variation in the genus (see Okamoto and Motomura 2013 : table 2; Okamoto 2015 : table 3). These minor differences are considered as intraspecific variation.

16702, 150.8 mm SL, BSKU 16703, 128.6 mm SL, 09°27.0′S , 127°58.6′E – 09°28.5′S , 127°56.1′E , Timor Sea ,
610–690 m depth
,
18–19 June 1972
; CAS 234746 , 121.0 mm SL, 09°54.09′S , 12°44.47′E , off Angola , southeastern Atlantic Ocean ,
620–630 m depth
,
10 March 2007
.
Epigonus telescopus : SNFR
16711, 635 mm SL, SNFR 16712, 706 mm SL, 37°25′00˝S , 50°27′00˝E , southwestern Indian Ocean ,
661–690 m depth
,

.
Epigonus sp.
:
MNHN 2014- 1583, 117.3 mm SL, 12°52.28′S , 48°07.41′E , Madagascar ,
558–592 m depth
,

. Other examined material of
